    The latest in Shane Drafahl IndustriesÂ® has led to the development in a way to modulate your server needs into one convenient way to communicate with a server you own.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ShaneConnect

        public ShaneConnect(java.lang.String url,
                    Context d)
        Parameters:
        url - is a String object that holds the location of the server you want to connect to and example may be http://10.0.2.2:3019 do not enter the address of the post request
        d - is the MainActivity that controls the runtime of the app, for example to give an argument of this from the MainActivity class is just to type "this".

    • Method Detail

      • getAccountData

        public void getAccountData(java.lang.String account_name,
                           <any> s)
        getAccountData will make a call to the server to get a json object of the representing account user given as an argument.
        Parameters:
        account_name - this is the name of the account you want data from, for example "SMITH_BOB_1" would be an argument. The convention is that the last name, first name, and a unique ID are concatenated together with underscores to create the username.
        s - is a asynchronous callback function

      • createAccount

        public void createAccount(java.lang.String lname,
                          java.lang.String fname,
                          java.lang.String permissionString,
                          int status,
                          java.lang.String password,
                          java.lang.String address,
                          java.lang.String cell,
                          java.lang.String phone,
                          int hourlyRate,
                          <any> s)
        This creates a user on the EMPLOYEES database and returns the username for the new employee
        Parameters:
        lname - the last name
        fname - the first name
        permissionString - a string of characters that correspond to permissions such as 1111
        status - could be used for different levels of the company. For example 2 might be manager and 0 be super user
        password - a password
        address - the address of the employee
        cell - the cellphone number
        phone - their primary phone number

      • newEmployeeLog

        public void newEmployeeLog(java.lang.String user,
                           int isClockingIn,
                           <any> s)
        Parameters:
        user - the user name such as Smith_Bob_1
        isClockingIn - enter 1 if clocking in, 0 if clocking out
        s - returns json object in the form in the response {error:int} if the error is 0 then is was added to the db

      • getFood

        public void getFood(java.lang.String name,
                    <any> s)
        The response should provide a json object in the form {name:String,food_id:int,quantity: int,price:int,desc:String} returns null if nothing found.
        Parameters:
        name - of food
        s - response listenter that the response json object is in the form {name:String,food_id:String,quantity:int,price:int,desc:String}

      • addFood

        public void addFood(java.lang.String name,
                    int price,
                    java.lang.String desc,
                    int quan,
                    <any> s)
        Way to add food, if the database already has a food item of the same name it will update the quantitiy and price but if it does not exist it will make a new entry.
        Parameters:
        name - name of food item.
        price - price of the food item.
        desc - description of food item.
        quan - the quantity of items
        s - call back method response will be null if did not work

      • placeOrder

        public void placeOrder(java.lang.String desc,
                       java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> comp,
                       int price,
                       java.lang.String local,
                       <any> s)
        Method used to place orders
        Parameters:
        desc - description of the order
        comp - a list of food items used in this order for example if you ordered a hamburger and there was a hamburger in the food table you would do list.add("hamburger").
        local - A string that holds the location or where the meal will go. For example table 9
        s - response method that responds with a json object in the form of {success:1} but if it failed to do it wont return anything and be null.

      • getOrders

        public void getOrders(int index,
                      <any> s)
        Gets orders, Response.Listener must be used recursively to call this function. If Response is empty then that means there are no more orders.
        Parameters:
        index - this should be 0 and then recursively add index+1
        s - event response, sends JSON in the form {desc:String,order_id:int,componentString:String,local:String,price:int}. local is the location either being a table or an address.

      • getFoodByID

        public void getFoodByID(java.lang.String foodIDS,
                        <any> s)
        Method to get all the food in a given id string. May be useful when working with getting orders.
        Parameters:
        foodIDS - a string of food orders in the form x-x-x- . The format given from calling getOrders should work when using the componentString from the given JSON object.
        s - response method, the response json object is in the format {NAME(ID):String,FOOD_ID(ID):int,QUANTITY(ID):int,PRICE(ID):int,DESCR(ID):String}, Where (ID) is the concatenation of DESCR + ID for example.
